title: Government abandons plans to delay 30 council elections
partialText: All English elections will now go ahead as originally planned after Reform UK brought a legal challenge over the decision to delay some polls.

title: How dark web agent spotted bedroom wall clue to rescue girl from years of harm
partialText: Detectives desperate to locate a 12-year-old, seen abused online, found a surprising lead.

title: Hillary Clinton accuses Trump administration of Epstein files 'cover-up' in BBC interview
partialText: "Get the files out. They are slow-walking it," the former US secretary of state says. The White House says it has done "more for the victims than Democrats ever did".

title: Facing a demographic catastrophe, Ukraine is paying for troops to freeze their sperm
partialText: The law funds troops who want to freeze their eggs or their sperm, as Ukraine's population plummets.

title: Actor Robert Duvall, who starred in The Godfather, dies aged 95
partialText: The Oscar-winner died "peacefully" at his home in Middleburg, Virginia, on Sunday, his family says.

title: Six of Sarah Ferguson's companies winding down
partialText: The move follows further revelations over her friendship with the convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein.

title: The tech bros might show more humility in Delhi – but will they make AI any safer?
partialText: As global tech leaders meet Delhi, India hopes to level the playing field for countries outside the US and China.

title: Ancient bone may prove legendary war elephant crossing of Alps
partialText: It would be the first hard evidence that elephants were used in battle by General Hannibal.

title: US build-up of warships and fighter jets tracked near Iran
partialText: BBC Verify has seen US aircraft carrier USS Abraham Lincoln near Iran ahead of talks between the two countries

title: Bailiffs used to pursue NHS staff over pay errors
partialText: Thousands of NHS workers were pursued by debt collectors after salary overpayments, the BBC finds.

title: Ice and snow warnings as another blast of Arctic air sweeps across the UK
partialText: More than 70 flood warnings have also been issued by the Environment Agency after heavy rain.

title: GB men's curlers' semi-final hopes on line after shock defeat
partialText: The Winter Olympics medal hopes of Team GB's men's curlers have been cast into doubt after a shock 8-6 defeat by Norway left them scrambling to make the semi-finals in Cortina.

title: GB slalom legend Ryding bids farewell to Olympics
partialText: Slalom skier Dave Ryding bids farewell to the Winter Olympics with a 17th-place finish in mixed conditions in Bormio.

title: Ski jumper disqualified for wearing oversized boots
partialText: Austrian ski jumper Daniel Tschofenig is disqualified from the men's large hill individual event for wearing oversized boots.

title: A big day for GB's men's curling team - Tuesday's guide
partialText: What's happening and who to look out for at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina.

title: Can you really depuff your face? The truth about three common treatments
partialText: We look at three viral hacks to unpick fact from fiction - the effects are often at best, temporary, say experts.

title: The Papers: 'Farage forces elections U-turn' and 'Tributes to Godfather Star'
partialText: Sir Keir Starmer's decision to abandon plans to delay 30 council elections after a legal challenge from Reform UK dominates Tuesday's papers.

title: Oasis v Blur rivalry being revived in new play as cast take sides
partialText: The 1995 chart battle is recreated for a new play - and the rivalry is rekindled as the cast take sides.

title: How Robert Duvall became a Hollywood great
partialText: A look at the life of the prolific actor whose many films included Apocalypse Now and The Godfather.

title: A simple guide to the May elections in England, Scotland and Wales
partialText: Millions will vote in parliamentary elections in Scotland and Wales, and local elections in England.

title: The £10 tricks I used to make my rented room into a home
partialText: Talented tenants share decor hacks that won't cost you a fortune - or your deposit.

title: Trump's new world order has become real and Europe is having to adjust fast
partialText: European nations are asking whether traditional alliances can suffice, or whether they should be diversifying

title: Italy's 'Lovers’ Arch' collapses into sea on Valentine's Day
partialText: The popular tourist attraction was a proposal spot for couples and featured on postcards.

title: Australian IS families in Syria camp turned back after leaving for home
partialText: The group of 34 women and children with family links to Islamic State group have been held in the Roj camp for nearly seven years.

title: Students begin Covid compensation claim against 36 more universities
partialText: It comes after University College London settled a claim from students there over lost learning in the pandemic.

title: Teenagers guilty of killing man they thought was a paedophile
partialText: Alexander Cashford was chased and hit with rocks and a bottle before he died.

title: League One Mansfield to host Arsenal in fifth round - full FA Cup draw
partialText: League One club Mansfield will host record 14-time winners Arsenal at Field Mill in the FA Cup fifth round, as Manchester City head to Newcastle in a repeat of the League Cup semi-final.

title: Five injured as Swiss train derails in heavy snow
partialText: One passenger was taken to hospital after the derailment, which police say could have been caused by an avalanche.

title: Police framed man for female student’s murder, evidence gathered by BBC suggests
partialText: Officers knew CCTV discredited their key witness in Omar Benguit's conviction for murder of Korean woman.

title: BBC News app
partialText: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Is It The End Of The Global Order As We Know It?
partialText: Starmer says Europe must be ready to fight, but can it afford to?

title: Will the US Supreme Court stand up to Trump?
partialText: Or will the court expand the US president’s power?

title: FA Cup heroes Macclesfield make memories to last a lifetime
partialText: Macclesfield's FA Cup odyssey may have ended against Brentford but they have made memories to last a lifetime, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

title: Muir fourth in big air in another medal near-miss
partialText: Freestyle skier Kirsty Muir once again comes heartbreakingly close to a Winter Olympic medal for Team GB with her second fourth-place finish of the Games.

title: 'I bring a circus' - ringmaster Fury in 'prime' for Makhmudov fight
partialText: Showman Tyson Fury says he is "coming back to make boxing great again" as he prepares to fight Russia's Arslanbek Makhmudov in April.

title: 'People shouldn't be dying just for existing' - Gauff on US issues
partialText: Coco Gauff says it is "tough to wake up" and see what is happening back home in the United States amid the president's immigration crackdown.

title: League One Mansfield to host Arsenal in fifth round - full FA Cup draw
partialText: League One club Mansfield will host record 14-time winners Arsenal at Field Mill in the FA Cup fifth round, as Manchester City head to Newcastle in a repeat of the League Cup semi-final.

title: Will we see changes to first England squad in 2026?
partialText: The Lionesses return to competitive action next month as their campaign to qualify for the 2027 Women's World Cup begins. So what changes could we see?
